abstract.t: Cellular IP specifies a protocol that allows routing IP datagrams to a mobile host. The protocol is intended to provide local mobility and handoff support. It can interwork with Mobile IP [1] to provide wide area mobility support. This I-D provides performance results based on the implementation and analysis of Cellular IP as defined by draft draft-valko-cellularip-01.txt [2]. The evaluation is focused on handoff performance, optimum active-state-timeout choice and scalability issues. The Cellular IP source code used for the experimental results presented in this Internet-Draft is freely available from comet.columbia.edu/cellularip.
